briefdescription.para: Compile time constant representing what kind of schema this class is.
Construct a UsdSkelBindingAPI on UsdPrim prim .

detaileddescription.para: Equivalent to UsdSkelBindingAPI::Get(prim.GetStage(), prim.GetPath()) for a valid prim, but will not immediately throw an error for an invalid prim

briefdescription.para: Construct a UsdSkelBindingAPI on the prim held by schemaObj .

detaileddescription.para: Should be preferred over UsdSkelBindingAPI(schemaObj.GetPrim()), as it preserves SchemaBase state.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
The skinningMethod specifies the skinning method for the prim.
See GetSkinningMethodAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Encodes the bind-time world space transforms of the prim.

detaileddescription.para: If the transform is identical for a group of gprims that share a common ancestor, the transform may be authored on the ancestor, to "inherit" down to all the leaf gprims. If this transform is unset, an identity transform is used instead.

briefdescription.para: See GetGeomBindTransformAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: An (optional) array of tokens defining the list of joints to which jointIndices apply.

detaileddescription.para: If not defined, jointIndices applies to the ordered list of joints defined in the bound Skeleton's joints attribute. If undefined on a primitive, the primitive inherits the value of the nearest ancestor prim, if any.

briefdescription.para: See GetJointsAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Indices into the joints attribute of the closest (in namespace) bound Skeleton that affect each point of a PointBased gprim.

detaileddescription.para: The primvar can have either constant or vertex interpolation. This primvar's elementSize will determine how many joint influences apply to each point. Indices must point be valid. Null influences should be defined by setting values in jointWeights to zero. See UsdGeomPrimvar for more information on interpolation and elementSize.

briefdescription.para: See GetJointIndicesAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Weights for the joints that affect each point of a PointBased gprim.

detaileddescription.para: The primvar can have either constant or vertex interpolation. This primvar's elementSize will determine how many joints influences apply to each point. The length, interpolation, and elementSize of jointWeights must match that of jointIndices. See UsdGeomPrimvar for more information on interpolation and elementSize.

briefdescription.para: See GetJointWeightsAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: An array of tokens defining the order onto which blend shape weights from an animation source map onto the skel:blendShapeTargets rel of a binding site.

detaileddescription.para: If authored, the number of elements must be equal to the number of targets in the blendShapeTargets rel. This property is not inherited hierarchically, and is expected to be authored directly on the skinnable primitive to which the blend shapes apply.

briefdescription.para: See GetBlendShapesAttr(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Animation source to be bound to Skeleton primitives at or beneath the location at which this property is defined.
See GetAnimationSourceRel(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.
Skeleton to be bound to this prim and its descendents that possess a mapping and weighting to the joints of the identified Skeleton.
See GetSkeletonRel(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.
Ordered list of all target blend shapes.

detaileddescription.para: This property is not inherited hierarchically, and is expected to be authored directly on the skinnable primitive to which the the blend shapes apply.

briefdescription.para: See GetBlendShapeTargetsRel(), and also Create vs Get Property Methods for when to use Get vs Create.
Convenience function to get the jointIndices attribute as a primvar.
Convenience function to create the jointIndices primvar, optionally specifying elementSize.

detaileddescription.para: If constant is true, the resulting primvar is configured with 'constant' interpolation, and describes a rigid deformation. Otherwise, the primvar is configured with 'vertex' interpolation, and describes joint influences that vary per point.

briefdescription.para: Convenience function to get the jointWeights attribute as a primvar.
Convenience function to create the jointWeights primvar, optionally specifying elementSize.

detaileddescription.para: If constant is true, the resulting primvar is configured with 'constant' interpolation, and describes a rigid deformation. Otherwise, the primvar is configured with 'vertex' interpolation, and describes joint influences that vary per point.

briefdescription.para: Convenience method for defining joints influences that make a primitive rigidly deformed by a single joint.
Convenience method to query the Skeleton bound on this prim.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if a Skeleton binding is defined, and sets skel to the target skel. The resulting Skeleton may still be invalid, if the Skeleton has been explicitly unbound.
This does not resolved inherited skeleton bindings.

briefdescription.para: Convenience method to query the animation source bound on this prim.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if an animation source binding is defined, and sets prim to the target prim. The resulting primitive may still be invalid, if the prim has been explicitly unbound.
This does not resolved inherited animation source bindings.

briefdescription.para: Returns the skeleton bound at this prim, or one of its ancestors.
Returns the animation source bound at this prim, or one of its ancestors.
Return a vector of names of all pre-declared attributes for this schema class and all its ancestor classes.

detaileddescription.para: Does not include attributes that may be authored by custom/extended methods of the schemas involved.

briefdescription.para: Return a UsdSkelBindingAPI holding the prim adhering to this schema at path on stage.

detaileddescription.para: If no prim exists at path on stage, or if the prim at that path does not adhere to this schema, return an invalid schema object. This is shorthand for the following:

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this single-apply API schema can be applied to the given prim.

detaileddescription.para: If this schema can not be a applied to the prim, this returns false and, if provided, populates whyNot with the reason it can not be applied.

Note that if CanApply returns false, that does not necessarily imply that calling Apply will fail. Callers are expected to call CanApply before calling Apply if they want to ensure that it is valid to apply a schema.

briefdescription.para: Applies this single-apply API schema to the given prim.

detaileddescription.para: This information is stored by adding "SkelBindingAPI" to the token-valued, listOp metadata apiSchemas on the prim.

simplesect.para: A valid UsdSkelBindingAPI object is returned upon success. An invalid (or empty) UsdSkelBindingAPI object is returned upon failure. See UsdPrim::ApplyAPI() for conditions resulting in failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (TfSpan< const int > indices, size_t numJoints, std::string *reason=nullptr)
memberdef.name: ValidateJointIndices

briefdescription.para: Validate an array of joint indices.

detaileddescription.para: This ensures that all indices are the in the range [0, numJoints). Returns true if the indices are valid, or false otherwise. If invalid and reason is non-null, an error message describing the first validation error will be set.

briefdescription.para: Returns the kind of schema this class belongs to.
Provides API for authoring and extracting all the skinning-related data that lives in the "geometry hierarchy" of prims and models that want to be skeletally deformed.

detaileddescription.para: See the extended UsdSkelBindingAPI schema documentation for more about bindings and how they apply in a scene graph.

For any described attribute Fallback Value or Allowed Values below that are text/tokens, the actual token is published and defined in UsdSkelTokens. So to set an attribute to the value "rightHanded", use UsdSkelTokens->rightHanded as the value.
